Description: Sherd of flat pottery lid or strainer; many punched holes; relief decoration. Red-brown Nile silt with abundant mixca and sand inclusions.
Curator's comments: This design is known from Ptolemaic 'cake stamps'. Stamped decoration, possibly from a 'cake stamp' (also known from Ptolemaic stoppers). Possibly used as a wine strainer to collect pips when filling amphora?
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IC.187)
